name: Parallels Desktop Configuration File
summary: A PVS file is a configuration file for a virtual machine (VM) created by Parallels Desktop for Mac, a virtualization application for Macs that can run other operating systems. It contains settings in the XML standard configuring a VM, including its name, memory usage, and how it shuts down.

open.note: Open with an associated app listed below.

images.caption: PVS file open in Parallels Desktop for Mac 20
images.alt: PVS file open in Parallels Desktop for Mac 20
